Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Discard \Dis*card"\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Discarded}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Discarding}.] 1. (Card Playing) To throw out of one's hand, as superfluous cards; to lay aside (a card or cards). [1913 Webster]
2. To cast off as useless or as no longer of service; to dismiss from employment, confidence, or favor; to discharge; to turn away. [1913 Webster]
They blame the favorites, and think it nothing extraordinary that the queen should . . . resolve to discard them. --Swift. [1913 Webster]
3. To put or thrust away; to reject. [1913 Webster]
A man discards the follies of boyhood. --I. Taylor.
Syn: To dismiss; displace; discharge; cashier. [1913 Webster]

discarded adj 1: thrown away; "wearing someone's cast-off clothes"; "throwaway children living on the streets"; "salvaged some thrown-away furniture" [syn: {cast-off(a)}, {throwaway(a)}, {thrown-away(a)}] 2: disposed of as useless; "waste paper" [syn: {cast-off(a)}, {junked}, {scrap(a)}, {waste}]
